headline.main: Oklahoma Lethal Injection Drug Faces U.S. Supreme Court Test
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma Lethal Injection Drug Faces U.S. Supreme Court Test

docs.snippet: The U.S. Supreme Court is set to hear arguments this week on whether a drug used in Oklahoma's lethal injection mix should be banned in a case that comes as a shortage of execution chemicals has sent some states scrambling for alternatives....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court is set to hear arguments this week on whether a drug used in Oklahoma's lethal injection mix should be banned in a case that comes as a shortage of execution chemicals has sent some states scrambling for alternatives.

headline.main: In Kathmandu Valley, Quake-Hit Nepalis Fend for Themselves
headline.print_headline: In Kathmandu Valley, Quake-Hit Nepalis Fend for Themselves

docs.snippet: Barely any sign of an organized relief effort was visible outside Nepal's capital on Sunday, as aid agencies struggled to fly and truck relief supplies to a country stricken by its worst earthquake in eight decades....
docs.lead_paragraph: Barely any sign of an organized relief effort was visible outside Nepal's capital on Sunday, as aid agencies struggled to fly and truck relief supplies to a country stricken by its worst earthquake in eight decades.

headline.main: Three U.S. Citizens Among Dead in Avalanche After Nepal Quake
headline.print_headline: Three U.S. Citizens Among Dead in Avalanche After Nepal Quake

docs.snippet: Three Americans died in a massive avalanche triggered by the devastating Nepal earthquake, the U.S. State Department said on Sunday, including a medic and a filmmaker who were at a base camp for Mount Everest climbers....
docs.lead_paragraph: Three Americans died in a massive avalanche triggered by the devastating Nepal earthquake, the U.S. State Department said on Sunday, including a medic and a filmmaker who were at a base camp for Mount Everest climbers.

docs.snippet: Through Joshua Oppenheimer’s work filming perpetrators of the Indonesian genocide, a family of survivors discovers how their son was murdered — and the identity of the men who murdered him....
docs.lead_paragraph: Through Joshua Oppenheimer’s work filming perpetrators of the Indonesian genocide, a family of survivors discovers how their son was murdered — and the identity of the men who murdered him.

headline.main: Suriname Promise to Vote for Van Praag in FIFA Election
headline.print_headline: Suriname Promise to Vote for Van Praag in FIFA Election

docs.snippet: Suriname have pledged to support Michael van Praag in next month's FIFA presidential election, becoming the first national association to publicly promise their vote to the Dutchman....
docs.lead_paragraph: Suriname have pledged to support Michael van Praag in next month's FIFA presidential election, becoming the first national association to publicly promise their vote to the Dutchman.

headline.main: Quake rescue efforts continue in Nepal amid aftershocks
headline.sub: Quake rescue efforts continue in Nepal amid aftershocks

docs.snippet: Rescuers work all night to save earthquake survivors trapped in collapsed buildings in Kathmandu amid ongoing aftershocks. Rough Cut (no reporter narration)....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rescuers work all night to save earthquake survivors trapped in collapsed buildings in Kathmandu amid ongoing aftershocks. Rough Cut (no reporter narration).

headline.main: Pleas for Mercy Rain on Indonesia's President as Executions Near
headline.print_headline: Pleas for Mercy Rain on Indonesia's President as Executions Near

docs.snippet: Relatives of several convicts on death row in Indonesia made emotional last-ditch appeals for mercy on Sunday, adding their voices to foreign governments and the head of the United Nations who called for the group of nine to be spared the firing s...
docs.lead_paragraph: Relatives of several convicts on death row in Indonesia made emotional last-ditch appeals for mercy on Sunday, adding their voices to foreign governments and the head of the United Nations who called for the group of nine to be spared the firing squad.

headline.main: Fighting Rages in Yemen's 3rd-Largest City, Strikes Continue
headline.print_headline: Fighting Rages in Yemen's 3rd-Largest City, Strikes Continue

docs.snippet: Deadly street battles raged in Yemen's third-largest city on Sunday, as airstrikes by the Saudi-led coalition battling Shiite rebels struck targets in several cities, security officials said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Deadly street battles raged in Yemen's third-largest city on Sunday, as airstrikes by the Saudi-led coalition battling Shiite rebels struck targets in several cities, security officials said.

headline.main: Witnesses to Everest Avalanche: 'I Knew I Had to Survive'
headline.print_headline: Witnesses to Everest Avalanche: 'I Knew I Had to Survive'

docs.snippet: At least 17 people were killed and 61 injured when an avalanche set off by Saturday's massive Nepal earthquake swept down the Himalayas. The snow and ice ripped through key Mt. Everest climbing routes and tore into base camp, the nylon mountaineer...
docs.lead_paragraph: At least 17 people were killed and 61 injured when an avalanche set off by Saturday's massive Nepal earthquake swept down the Himalayas. The snow and ice ripped through key Mt. Everest climbing routes and tore into base camp, the nylon mountaineering city that blossoms every year at the base of the world's highest peak. On Sunday, the first group of survivors was flown in to Kathmandu; most of the 15 people are injured Sherpa guides. Two spoke to The Associated Press:

headline.main: ECB's Liikanen Warns of Asset Price Bubbles Due to Low Interest Rates
headline.print_headline: ECB's Liikanen Warns of Asset Price Bubbles Due to Low Interest Rates

docs.snippet: A flood of cheap money risks creating bubbles in financial markets if interest rates remain low for a long period, European Central Bank Governing Council member Erkki Liikanen was quoted as saying on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A flood of cheap money risks creating bubbles in financial markets if interest rates remain low for a long period, European Central Bank Governing Council member Erkki Liikanen was quoted as saying on Sunday.
